meanings.definition: To a considerable extent or degree
meanings.sent1: She sizably improved her grades after studying hard.
meanings.sent2: The tree sizably grew taller over the summer.
meanings.sent3: The cat sizably stretched its body after waking up from a nap.
meanings.sent4: His smile sizably brightened the room when he entered.
meanings.sent5: The flowers sizably bloomed in the warm sunlight.

meanings.definition: In a large or significant manner
meanings.sent1: The cake was sizably larger than the one she usually baked.
meanings.sent2: He ran sizably faster than his friends in the race.
meanings.sent3: The dog barked sizably louder when it heard a noise outside.
meanings.sent4: The mountain loomed sizably over the tiny village below.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks lit up the sky sizably during the celebration.
